summary: Threats to U.S. national security continue to evolve with technological, economic, and social changes. Federal agencies identified 26 long-term threats within 4 categories: 1) Adversaries' Political and Military Advancements —e.g., China's increasing ability to match the U.S. military's strength. 2) Dual-Use Technologies —e.g., self-driving cars might be developed for private use, but militaries can use them too. 3) Weapons —advances in weapons technology, e.g., cyberweapons...
title: National Security: Long-Range Emerging Threats Facing the United States As Identified by Federal Agencies
